body.p:
Louisville, Ky., July 2n 1865.
Governor Bramblet Dear Sir

I address you with a few lines and state to you that I have aplied for a pension -- I took the depositions of D C Miller and John Murry proveing that I was in the United States service and that I was on duty and at my post at the time of receiving my ingurys which was haveing my side brake in and was ruptured -- also I got the Certificate of diability from the board of Government Sergeans -- And proved my Identity by Captain Isam Borland and John Calhoon of Libierty -- and sent them up to Washington -- they acknowledged the Receipt of them -- they also require a Certifficate of some Commissand officer of the Regement ^in this County case, also -- ^. I now ask you as a special favar to fill this Certifficate
As ^I^ am perfectly un able to do heavy labour -- I wrote to you some time ^ago^ with regard to geting a new Discharge as I have last my old Discharge & hope you will attend to that --

I now subscribe myself yours
Fraternally --
Joseph Morehead
